name: Foundations
description: Primitive capabilities — Task tool gains basic write and bash powers, establishing the delegation primitive that will power all future multi-agent patterns

name: Task Tool
description: Primary tool for spawning subagents and delegating work. Originally just file/bash delegation, evolved into the core orchestration primitive.

title: Task tool gains write & bash capabilities

entries.text: Task tool can now perform writes and run bash commands

title: Architecture at this point
commentary: The Task tool is the primitive that will eventually power all multi-agent patterns. At this stage it's a single-level delegation mechanism for file and shell operations.

name: Custom Agents Era
description: User-defined agents emerge — SDKs released, custom subagent definitions, agent markdown files with frontmatter configuration

name: Custom Agents
description: User-defined agents via markdown files with frontmatter for system prompt, tools, and model configuration. Stored in .claude/agents/.

name: /agents command
description: CLI command for creating and managing custom agent definitions interactively.

entries.text: Released TypeScript SDK: import @anthropic-ai/claude-code
Released Python SDK: pip install claude-code-sdk

title: Significance
commentary: SDKs enable programmatic agent creation outside the CLI, laying groundwork for custom agent definitions and external orchestration.

entries.text: You can now create custom subagents for specialized tasks! Run /agents to get started

title: New interaction pattern
commentary: Users can now define agent markdown files with system prompts and tool restrictions. The /agents command provides a UI for creating and managing them.

name: SessionStart
description: Hook event fired on new session initialization. Extended in 2.1.33 with agent_type field.

entries.text: Hooks: Added SessionStart hook for new session initialization
Added @-mention support with typeahead for custom agents
Agents: Added model customization support — specify which model an agent should use
Agents: Fixed unintended access to the recursive agent tool
Agents: Fix custom agent loading when agent files are unparsable

name: Agent SDK Era
description: SDK rebranded to Agent SDK, built-in specialized agents (Explore, Plan), background agents, lifecycle hooks, and rich agent configuration parameters

title: Claude Code SDK → Claude Agent SDK

entries.text: SDK: The Claude Code SDK is now the Claude Agent SDK
Add subagents dynamically with --agents flag

title: Breaking change significance
commentary: The rename from 'Code SDK' to 'Agent SDK' signals Anthropic's strategic shift toward agent-first architecture. The SDK now explicitly supports multi-agent orchestration patterns.

name: Explore Agent
description: Built-in Haiku-powered subagent specialized for efficient codebase search via Glob, Grep, and Read tools.

name: Plan Agent
description: Built-in subagent for architecture planning with thinking capabilities. Uses Sonnet by default in plan mode.

entries.text: Introducing the Explore subagent. Powered by Haiku it'll search through your codebase efficiently
Haiku 4.5 automatically uses Sonnet in plan mode, Haiku for execution (SonnetPlan by default)

title: First built-in specialized agent
commentary: First built-in specialized agent type with automatic model selection. Establishes the pattern of purpose-built agents using cheaper, faster models.

entries.text: Plan mode: introduced new Plan subagent
Subagents: claude can now choose to resume subagents
Subagents: claude can dynamically choose the model used by its subagents

title: Agent-to-agent interaction deepens
commentary: Agents gain persistence (resume) and the main agent becomes an orchestrator that can dynamically select which model a subagent runs on.

name: disallowedTools
description: Agent frontmatter field for explicit tool blocking. Scopes agent capabilities by listing tools the agent cannot use.

entries.text: Added disallowedTools field to custom agent definitions for explicit tool blocking

name: SubagentStop
description: Hook event fired when a subagent completes. Fields: agent_id, agent_transcript_path (added in 2.0.42).

entries.text: Added agent_id and agent_transcript_path fields to SubagentStop hooks

name: SubagentStart
description: Hook event fired when a subagent is launched. Enables external systems to observe agent lifecycle.

name: permissionMode
description: Agent frontmatter field controlling how the agent handles permission requests (e.g., auto-accept in CI).

name: skills frontmatter
description: Agent frontmatter field to declare skills to auto-load for subagents, enabling capability inheritance.

entries.text: Added SubagentStart hook event
Hooks: Split Stop hook triggering into Stop and SubagentStop
Added permissionMode field for custom agents
Added skills frontmatter field to declare skills to auto-load for subagents

title: Agent lifecycle hooks
commentary: External systems can now observe and react to agent lifecycle events. permissionMode controls how the agent handles permission requests. skills allows agents to inherit capabilities from skill definitions.

name: PermissionRequest
description: Hook event for intercepting tool permission requests to automatically approve or deny with custom logic.

entries.text: Added PermissionRequest hook to automatically approve or deny tool permission requests with custom logic

title: Automated permission control
commentary: Agents can now have their permission requests automatically handled by custom hook logic, enabling fully autonomous execution in CI/CD pipelines.

name: --agent / agent setting
description: CLI flag and config setting to start the main session scoped to a specific agent's system prompt, tools, and model.

entries.text: Added --agent CLI flag to override the agent setting for the current session
Added agent setting to configure main thread with a specific agent's system prompt, tool restrictions, and model

name: Background Agents
description: Agents that run asynchronously in the background while the user continues working. First true concurrent multi-agent pattern.

entries.text: Added background agent support. Agents run in the background while you work

title: Async agent pattern
commentary: First true concurrent multi-agent pattern. The user can continue working while a background agent handles a long-running task asynchronously.

title: Background agents can wake main agent

entries.text: Agents can send asynchronous messages to wake up the main agent

name: TaskOutputTool
description: Unified tool for reading output from background tasks and agents. Replaced the separate AgentOutputTool and BashOutputTool.

entries.text: Unshipped AgentOutputTool and BashOutputTool, in favor of a new unified TaskOutputTool

title: Tool consolidation
commentary: Two separate output tools were unified into one. TaskOutputTool provides a single interface to retrieve results from both background agents and background bash commands.

name: Orchestration Era
description: Full orchestration — task management with dependencies, agent teams for multi-agent collaboration, inter-agent communication and coordination

entries.text: Added unified Ctrl+B backgrounding for both bash commands and agents
Added new task management system, including new capabilities like dependency tracking
Fixed out-of-memory crashes when resuming sessions with heavy subagent usage

title: Task dependency graph
commentary: Tasks can now declare dependencies on other tasks, enabling DAG-style execution of multi-agent workflows. This is a prerequisite for the full Agent Teams feature.

entries.text: Agents: Fixed agent list displaying 'Sonnet (default)' instead of 'Inherit (default)' for agents without explicit model setting

title: Task tool metrics: tokens, duration, tool uses

entries.text: Added token count, tool uses, and duration metrics to Task tool results

name: Agent Teams
description: Multi-agent collaboration feature (research preview). Multiple agents work together as a team with inter-agent communication. Requires CLAUDE_CODE_EXPERIMENTAL_AGENT_TEAMS=1.

name: CLAUDE_CODE_EXPERIMENTAL_AGENT_TEAMS
description: Environment variable gate for the agent teams research preview feature. Set to 1 to enable.

entries.text: Added research preview agent teams feature for multi-agent collaboration (requires setting CLAUDE_CODE_EXPERIMENTAL_AGENT_TEAMS=1)
Claude Opus 4.6 is now available!
Claude now automatically records and recalls memories as it works

title: Agent Teams architecture
commentary: The culmination of the multi-agent journey. Multiple agents can now work together as a team, with inter-agent communication and coordination. Marked as token-intensive and gated behind an environment variable for the research preview. Released alongside Opus 4.6 and automatic memory.

name: TeammateIdle
description: Hook event fired when an agent teams teammate finishes work and is available for new assignments.

name: TaskCompleted
description: Hook event fired when a delegated task is completed within an agent teams workflow.

name: Task(agent_type)
description: Syntax in agent tools frontmatter to restrict which sub-agent types can be spawned. Security boundary for agent teams.

name: memory frontmatter
description: Agent frontmatter field enabling persistent memory with configurable scopes: user, project, local.

entries.text: Added TeammateIdle and TaskCompleted hook events for multi-agent workflows
Added support for restricting which sub-agents can be spawned via Task(agent_type) syntax in agent tools frontmatter
Added memory frontmatter field support for agents, enabling persistent memory with scopes (user, project, local)
Added agent_type to SessionStart hook input, populated if --agent is specified

title: Full agent teams lifecycle
commentary: Task(agent_type) restricts which agents can be spawned — a security boundary. TeammateIdle fires when a teammate finishes and is available for new work. TaskCompleted signals task completion. The memory field gives agents persistent context across sessions with configurable scopes.

title: Agent Teams model fix for Bedrock/Vertex/Foundry

entries.text: Fixed Agent Teams using wrong model identifier for Bedrock, Vertex, and Foundry customers
